{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents describe the management of anaphylaxis, including the use of adrenaline. Adrenaline has three main actions: beta-2 receptors for bronchodilation, alpha-1 receptors for cardiovascular effects, and presynaptic alpha-2 receptors to reduce norepinephrine release. There is no mention of adrenaline having an action on blood vessels by alpha-receptors in the provided documents.", "answer_choice": D}
